content: What narrow strip of land, also the name of an ancient city-state, connects mainland Greece with the Peloponnese peninsula?

The narrow strip of land that connects mainland Greece with the Peloponnese peninsula is called the Isthmus of Corinth. Additionally, there was an ancient city-state named Corinth located on this isthmus. So, the answer to your question is the Isthmus of Corinth, which is also associated with the ancient city-state of Corinth.
